intro: Hybanthus maytensillo, commonly known as the Maytenillo or Mayten tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitats.
